items.title: PHP Entwickler (m/w) to break limits in WordPress! Liebe Herausforderungen! at Inpsyde GmbH () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Web Design, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Du bist erfahrene/r oder talentierter Webentwickler/in auf den man sich verlassen kann, kennst dich mit objekt-orientierter PHP-Programmierung aus und möchtest zusammen mit anderen Top WordPress Entwicklern anspruchsvolle WordPress-Projekte mit höchster Code-Qualität im B2B-Bereich umsetzen?

Dann kannst du dir sicherlich vorstellen unter anderem an folgenden spannenden Projekten zu arbeiten:

  • In einem mehrsprachigen WooCommerce-Shop mit Anbindung an externe Dienste wie zum Beispiel SAP Business One
  • Weiterentwicklung und Support bekannter freier Plugins (z.B. BackWPup oder MultilingualPress)
  • Gestalten/Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter hoch performanter und sicherer Plugins, Schnittstellen und Themes für unsere Kunden, Dienstleister und die Community

Dich erwartet:

  • arbeiten im Homeoffice (wir sind 100% Remote)
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • sehr erfahrene WordPress Experten und Top SE User als Kollegen
  • als WordPress VIP Partner, direkter Draht zu WooCommerce und WP Core Entwickler
  • ganz nah am Puls der neuesten WordPress-Entwicklung und Technologien
  • spannende und außergewöhnliche Projekte
  • kleines Team in einem agilen Umfeld
  • wöchentlicher Wissenaustausch und Vorträge von Kollegen in einer Videokonferenz
  • tolle Kollegen, mit denen es jeden Tag Freude macht zusammenzuarbeiten
  • Besuche und Vorträge auf WordCamps und WooConf
  • flache Hierachien und kurze Entscheidungswege

Eintrittsdatum: So schnell wie möglich. Aber bei guten Entwicklern warten wir gerne.

Klingt alles interessant für dich? Dann bewerbe dich jetzt inkl. deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen, frühestmögliches Eintrittsdatum, Link zu deinem GitHub Account damit wir uns deine Code-Qualität anschauen können!

About Inpsyde GmbH

Arbeite mit unserem tollen Team von WordPress Experten und Top Usern auf WordPress Stack Exchange zusammen. Tausche dich aus, lerne von Ihnen oder lass dich gemeinsam im Team zu Höchstleistungen verleiten.

Im Gegensatz zu gewöhnlichen Arbeitgebern arbeitest du bei uns remote an immer neuen Herausforderungen in der WordPress Welt, wo du willst – in der Nähe deiner Kaffeemaschine, im Park oder an deinem Lieblingsort. Das bedeutet auch, dass du deine Arbeitszeiten flexibel einteilen kannst.

Via Slack, Hangout und Zoom kommunizierst du mit deinen Kollegen, während du unter anderem mit deiner Hardware und deinem Lieblingskaffee deine Arbeitsumgebung selbst gestaltest.

Oder treffe dich mit Kollegen auf WordCamps, Meetups oder WooConfs weltweit um sich dort auch mit anderen Entwicklern auszutauschen oder im Auftrage der Firma Vorträge zu halten.

Entwickle WordPress Plugins oder Webseiten für internationale Firmen wie Facebook, Mercedes, Parship oder WooCommerce Erweiterungen für E-Commerce Größen wie PayPal. Aber auch für Mittelstandsunternehmen, die Webseiten oder Plugins nicht von der Stange benötigen. 

Auch beteiligst du dich an der Mitarbeit an Plugins, die wir auf wordpress.org zur Verfügung stellen, wie zum Beispiel BackWPup mit über 5 Millionen Downloads und über 600.000 aktive User.

In kleinen Teams, einem Projektleiter und direktem Draht zum Chef kannst du dich und deine Ideen wertvoll einbringen.

Bewirb dich als PHP-Entwickler/in! Viele aufregende Möglichkeiten warten auf dich!

Werde Inpsyder!

Benefits

Homeoffice und flexible Arbeitszeiten - Wir Vertrauen unserem Team!
Keine langen Anfahrtszeiten! Vom Frühstückstisch in 1 Min. am Rechner!
28 Tage Urlaub
Immer in der Nähe der Familie um die man sich jederzeit kümmern kann.
Zuhause essen wo es am besten schmeckt anstatt labriges Kantinenfutter
Wir arbeiten mit Spaß! Flache Hierachien und gegenseitiger Respekt!
Nutzung der Tools deiner Wahl!
Kostenloses Spazierengehen, um den Kopf manchmal frei zu kriegen
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit speziellem Twist und Herausforderungen
Immer am Puls der WP-Entwicklung mit direkten Draht zu WP-Experten!

items.title: Write quality code that scales as our new backend dev at Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting (Nijmegen, Netherlands) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud Services, Network Engineering, Web Hosting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Do words like GIT, Ruby, AMQP, Docker, PHP, Composer, PHP unit and Redis make your developer heart beat faster? Do these technologies hold few secrets for you and are you capable of converting ideas into working and secure applications? If so, then we want to meet you.

We are looking for a creative developer to develop and maintain our back-end systems and web applications. In this position, you will work as part of a professional and enthusiastic team on optimising and developing our REST API, provisioning tools, client portals, ordering systems and other (web-based) applications.

Who are you?

  • Minimum higher vocational education (HBO) work and thinking level, with relevant work experience.
  • You are fluent in either PHP or Ruby and are willing to study other languages. Knowledge of Linux and WordPress is a prerequisite
  • Familiar with current (web) technologies such as Docker, Elasticsearch, Rails or AMQP. Knowledge of testing frameworks and deployment strategies.
  • A team player: Curious, enterprising and creative.

Job description

  • As a member of a team, you will work on automation, features and maintenance for a hosting platform with which we serve thousands of clients
  • You will work using Scrum tools to improve our platform in an agile manner
  • You believe in as much automation of processes as possible to ensure the highest possible level of uniformity and quality across the entire hosting platform
  • You can serve as a technical consultant for both internal departments and clients

You and Savvii

Starting on your first day at the company, you will be an essential part of a professional team. Your future? You will shape your own future by continuously developing yourself and by proactively seizing opportunities. We believe that your added value is greatest if you enjoy your work. We consider personal development, responsibility and substantial challenges to be essential to ensure the enjoyment of the work. Because we give you the space to utilize your talents to their full extent and through the sparring opportunities with skilled colleagues, you will continually work on your own development.

What makes it attractive for you to work for us?

  • Competitive salary that grows in tandem with your ambition
  • Informal work environment in a modern building equipped with lounge and roof terrace or a remote position
  • New Macbook Pro or Dell XPS laptop to enable you to work smoothly
  • Challenging work with your own responsibilities and growth potential
  • Training opportunities
  • Time to visit conferences
  • Time to contribute to Open Source
  • Time to experiment with new web technologies, such as in the form of hackathons
  • 100% travel allowance when travelling by public transport
  • Supplemental: chair massage by a real professional, company fitness programme, free fruit and media library

About Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting

About your team

Our dev team consists of 4 developers based in Nijmegen. We are also open to remote colleagues. Will you be the first of many new colleagues?

We believe in trying lots of new things, but in a way that is stable and scales across thousands of sites and servers. Things like TDD, (internal) penetration tests, code reviews and CI are our way of guaranteeing code quality.

There is room to contribute to Open Source projects, visit conferences and enhance your public speaking skills.

We are working with SCRUM, the team has either control about scope or planning.

What unites us is a love of games, tinkering with computers and electronics and throwing the occasional LAN or VR party at the office.

About Savvii

Savvii is the Managed WordPress host in Europe. Only hosting, only WordPress. Full stop.

This focus enables us to offer our clients the best hosting. We innovate continuously in the area of speed, scalability, security and convenience.

Our company is made up of young people with a passion for technology, gadgets and the latest developments on the Internet. As an organisation, we place a high value on commitment and we ensure that you can demonstrate an entrepreneurial character. At our company, you are allowed to make mistakes. We are open about that: internally and towards our clients. We also believe in sharing: for example, we organise the WordPress meet-up Nijmegen, sponsor and organise WordCamps and we also speak at WordCamps and other conferences.

Are you the candidate that we’re looking for? If so, don’t wait any longer and apply. A Certificate of Good Behaviour [Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag] will also be required as part of the application procedure.

For more information, please contact Lisa Nellestijn, our HR advisor, at +31(0)24-3605040. Of course, you can always stop by for a cup of coffee or tea to get an impression of the pleasant working atmosphere.

Benefits

Chair Massage
Free fruit
Remote working
MacBook Pro's
Contribution to your sports and excercise costs
Attending conferences
Contributing to Open Source initiatives

items.title: Software developer C/C++ at ZF Friedrichshafen AG (Pilsen, Tschechien) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior
Industry: Automotive, Autonomous Driving, Safety Technology
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Private

Job description

WHY JOIN ZF?

ZF operates a global network of technical centers worldwide where we employ engineers, researchers, designers and technicians. Our global network allows us to develop active and passive automotive safety technologies, while continuously improving existing products and systems.

Employees use sophisticated testing and computer simulation equipment. We have advanced engineering and research and development programs for next-generation products in all of our segments.

ZF is disciplined and innovative in our approach to research and development, employing various tools to improve efficiency and reduce cost, such as Six Sigma, "follow-the-sun" (a 24-hour a day engineering program that utilizes our global network) and other e-Engineering programs.

The safety technologies market is hot, and ZF is at the forefront. Come join the global leader in automotive safety and apply today!

The Software Team is responsible for the development and release of software for a number of high profile and challenging global applications with European, North American and Chinese vehicle manufactures. A senior software engineer is required to support this development striving for customer delight with timely deliveries, novel system functions and high quality software.

Your task:

  • SW requirements analysis
  • SW design in UML language
  • Programming of systems of automotive components in C and C++
  • Programming of SW for testing support for those systems
  • Integration to customer products and laboratory testing
  • Problems monitoring, analysis and solving

Skills & Requirements

Your profile:

  • Degree in a field of electronic, electrotechnic, applied science filed etc.
  • Knowledge of programming a single chip uC (SoC), electric drives and performing electronics
  • Good knowledge of English or German language
  • Knowledge of real-time SW development for automotive components is an advantage
  • Knowledge of C and C++ is an advantage

Are you interested?

Please apply online with full application documents (Resume, motivation for the position, references and certificates) indicating your salary expectations and your earlist staring date. Questions in advance will be answered by Mr. Ondrej Pohanka.

About ZF Friedrichshafen AG

We offer:

  • Trainings and workshops
  • A very interesting job – working on automotive future
  • Language lessons (English, German)
  • Flexible working hours
  • 25 days of holidays
  • Home office
  • Annual bonuses
  • Annual salary raise
  • Benefits: commuting allowances, pension/life insurance allowances
  • Lunches in our amazing canteen

Benefits

Flexible working time models
Numerous opportunities for professional development, training, expert
30 vacational days
Employees profit from various discounts
Christmas and Holiday Pay
Catering facilities on-site

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Telecommute) at I Will Teach You To Be Rich (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Full Stack Developer

Job description

Live your Rich Life from anywhere.  100% remote position.  

The Giant Hairy Problem You'll Be Solving

The best of all worlds: a development role in a startup environment without the risk of small organizations or the inflexibility of large ones.

We're looking for a seasoned full stack developer to join our team to create services that power incredible user experiences.

This could be a dream position for the right person. Read the description below to see if it's what you've been looking for and find out how to apply.

You'll Work On Projects Like

A Full Stack Developer at IWT is able to work in all parts of an application from backend services to middle tier and the front-end app. You will be developing new solutions to complex problems and work within our existing frameworks, while keeping an open mind to potential process improvements and scalability.

You will be a critical member of the engineering team; with that comes the responsibility of mentoring team members and establishing architectural principles and design patterns. You'll be translating functional requirements into functional applications. You'll be doing more than just bug hunting; you'll be proactively identifying bottlenecks and devising solutions to them.

You will also be interfacing with IWT's own home-grown solutions as well as with several third party API's. Expect to be immediately thrown into the deep end and getting into the code right away.

Compensation is commensurate with experience. Perks include health coverage, 401k with match, technology and education stipends, the ability to live anywhere in the US, and work with some of the most interesting people in the world.

What We're Looking For

At IWT we love hard problems that others can't solve, won't solve, or don't even want to try solving.  We want to work with people who love big challenges, too. People who want to be the best they can possibly be and fight every day to make it happen. We call them top performers and we all share the same values:

  • Obsessed with excellence
  • No ego
  • Outstanding communication
  • We drive results
  • Learn fast, grow fast
  • Be weird

If you're a good fit for this opportunity, then you'll have:

  • Broad Experience: You will be working in every aspect of the stack, from top to bottom in a variety of languages.
    • Extremely comfortable in PHP and experience with Ruby
    • Intimately familiar with CakePHP or Rails
    • Lots of practical experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MySQL
    • Experience with AWS 
    • Well rounded DevOps and performance tuning experience
    • Experience with Salesforce or Marketo is a definite plus
  • Hands On: You are naturally curious and want to understand how things work. You also aren't afraid to get your hands dirty and don't want to pass things off as "not my job" when issue arise.
  • Agile: Able to work iteratively and a willingness to change priorities based on changing business dynamics
  • A vision for the future: A knowledge of industry best practices and an eye toward the future and improving our processes continuously.
  • Able to work remotely with your own phone, computer and high speed internet access in place.
  • This is a full-time, 100% remote position. Must be US based.

About Us

For the past 13 years, we've quietly built a private company that has become one of the leaders in online education and self-developmentt. Over 1 million Top Performers read us every month for advice on money, entrepreneurship, careers, relationships, and personal productivity.  We build no-BS personal-development brands that deliver real results.  We tell the truth about how the world works -- even when it's uncomfortable to hear. We value trust over short-term sales.  We're selective and demanding about who we serve.  

We're a high performance team of exceptionally talented and diverse individuals, and we nurture each other's personalities, creativity and obsessions to bring forth unique content, products and services to the market. Our goal is to help millions of people live richer, more fulfilling lives. And it takes an entire team committed to something bigger than themselves to make that kind of impact.

We are seeking high caliber individuals who want to help push us to the next level. If you like to move quickly and have a bias for action, you'll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We're a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are. We're excited to work alongside the best in the world to make a difference in millions of people's lives.

About I Will Teach You To Be Rich

For the past 13 years, we’ve quietly built a private company that has become one of the leaders in online education and self-development. Over 1 million Top Performers read us every month for advice on money, entrepreneurship, careers, and relationships.

items.title: Linux Full Stack Developers (remote development) at VNN Inc (Grand Rapids, MI) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Education, E-Sports, Publishing
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

VNN is looking for experienced Linux full stack/PHP/Javascript Application developers. People who can make insightful, rapid, every-day decisions needed in a startup environment.

VNN enables athletic departments to leverage social technologies to promote their sports teams, in doing so crafting a unique and memorable experience for athletes. This person will be comfortable joining a small team leading that charge, based on a keen understanding of VNN’s business goals and strategy.

We need those who thrive on the pace of a start-up and embrace the many different roles they will have to play. Yet you will still be able to adapt processes and maintain strong design principles, making the trade-offs needed to meet timely delivery schedules.

While you’ll be responsible to work with a small team to ensure the successful execution of our technology strategy, you shouldn’t view yourself as a simple “developer”. Your success will also result from cultivating an ongoing relationship with operations, sales, marketing, technology partners, and advertisers leveraging those unique insights to craft user experience. Being able to work independently and in collaborative phases is a must.

While development is 100% a remote team, we prefer candidates who will travel to Grand Rapids, Michigan for the occasional in person planning meetings and company celebrations 2 or 3 times a year.

Skills & Requirements

The ideal candidate can currently describe themselves or wish to develop into the type of software professional defined here: What is a Full Stack Developer?

Preferred qualifications:

  • 4+ years experience application programming languages including PHP/MySQL 
  • Ability to program in various scripting languages: Angular, React, Ansible, NodeJS, Javascript etc
  • Working knowledge of LAMP or equivalent Linux Stack
  • Ability to change directions and priorities often and quickly
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills needed for the success of a remote group that leverages Slack and Hangouts
  • Interested in sports or related activities

About VNN Inc

VNN Inc is a rapidly growing, highly progressive company that is reshaping high school sports media from the ground up.  Regardless of the role, the VNN team embraces the power of storytelling, and works to bring clarity, beauty and fun to technology that enables fans to share the stories of high school athletes.  We are a company of 60 passionate makers and hustlers, who believe in the disruptive impact the right team and technology can have on an industry.  Our work begins with a deep understanding of the parents, athletes, coaches and administrators that make up high school sports, and ends with simple fun products that impact real people across the country. 

Working with our tight-knit team, you won’t have to worry about big company bureaucracy or not having an impact, the code you work on will be used by thousands on a daily basis.

Benefits

Free Snacks
Great working environment
Get Paid What you Deserve
Health Care
Flexible Remote Team

items.title: Senior Software Developers at Avaaz Foundation () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Non-Profit
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Avaaz is changing the world, and we’ll give you the means to change it, too. Our team is a place to exercise your creativity and your leadership while building never-before-seen tools for one of the world’s top online activism organizations. You can let your imagination run wild figuring out how to grow the platform and tools, improve rapid-iterative processes and integrate new technologies.

We are a nimble team working on creating opportunities to bring about the world most people everywhere want -- one of justice, peace, and freedom. The work environment is quite unique: whether you’re in the office or working from home, our collaborative culture ensures everyone is heard and treated respectfully, with a strong focus on personal development.

Our tech build comprises the latest technologies (cloud computing, distributed systems, big data) using great languages (Python, PHP, JS) with proven and cutting-edge datastores (MySQL, Redshift, MongoDB, Redis, Memcache). At Avaaz, your work will have an impact on a huge scale: we have more than 40 million members, who have taken over 200 million actions, told over 500 million friends about Avaaz campaigns and donated more than $50 million online.

 Our global and distributed tech team creates beautiful, efficient code that works across browsers, platforms, and localizations. It’s backed by developers with a proven track record of designing, building and debugging large web applications. 

We’re roaming the world in the search for challenge-driven hard-working developers and senior developers with excellent spoken and written communication in English who are able to adapt and learn, with talents for creativity and abstract thinking. The quest is for people who fit that profile; we know specific skills can always be trained and developed.  


Let’s chat -- I’m pretty sure you’ll want to join us.

We are currently hiring senior developers in the Americas, EU and African timezones.

Salary is competitive in the nonprofit space with generous benefits but we can not match corporate tech salaries.

APPLY HERE: https://secure.avaaz.org/en/hiring/#op-45362-senior-software-developers

Benefits

Work Remotely
Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive
5 weeks paid vacation per year

items.title: Software Engineer that does Drupal at Platform.sh () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Platform.sh, the Continuous Deployment PaaS, is seeking a backend Drupal developer with strong experience in Drupal 7 and e-commerce technologies (including Drupal Commerce and Magento). But you will have opportunities to work on many other technologies (from API proxies in NodeJS or Golang to Python libraries).  We don’t expect you to be an expert in all-the-things but we are looking for someone that would love to have a chance to work in a polyglot environment.


With your intimate knowledge of user authentication workflows (such as OAuth 2), deep knowledge about security processes, and mastery of transactional workflows, you will help build, improve, and maintain the Platform.sh internal billing and user management tool (aka Accounts).

Required:

  • Be a really really good dev that likes testing, understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works has a very good grasp of security
  • Minimum of 5+ years’ experience in working with Drupal.
  • Strong experience with maintaining and extending complex Drupal sites (you write Drush make files on the back of napkins and revert Features in your dreams)
  • Strong knowledge of Git workflows (code review based on pull/merge requests, submodules, automated deployments), and you can explain to a 5 year old what rebase means.
  • Strong experience with integrating external services to Drupal (extra points if you have “The API is the product” tattooed on your arm)
  • Familiar with Behat/Mink test suite and automated test workflows.
  • Familiar with Agile development methodology.
  • Be proficient in at least one programming language other than PHP and Javascript

Would be really great if you had:

  • Go Lang Practice
  • Python Experience
  • Good Networking background (routing/protocols)
  • Good grasp of practical security and cryptography
  • Good knowledge of how the Web works (Hacking Nginx with Lua a plus).
  • Good understanding of how database systems and search engines work
  • A good notion on distributed systems (consensus protocols like Raft/Paxos, eventual consistency models, gossip protocols)
  • Good understanding of virtualization and containers
  • Mad Debian Skills

About Platform.sh

Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program). To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our engineering team. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you

For its groundbreaking PaaS solution https://platform.sh is looking for a Pythonian Cloud Engineer with a taste for Go, good Linux system understanding, and a real hunger for the challenges of building robust, distributed systems.

Platform.sh is a PaaS shrouded in a lot of black magic (we can consistently clone a whole running cluster, with its state, databases, indexes in a matter of seconds). We want to get this down to the hundreds of milliseconds domain. Interested? There is more...

Our external API is pure Hypermedia REST + oAuth on top of Pyramid. It mechanizes the Git layer and needs more features.

We can consistently generate from the same manifest a Docker container, an LXC one, or VM disk images (AWS, Azure, OpenStack), we want more targets.

We probably have the highest industry container density. We need to get it higher.

We support any Python, Ruby, NodeJS or PHP application, it’s time to roll-out Java and .NET, and Elixir, of course Elixir.

We need to have more auto-healing on the high-availability clusters. We need more performance out of our multi-protocol ssh proxy. We need work on our Ceph Implementation; We need to get the Debian package generation streamlined and faster. We need… great ideas on how to make Platform.sh even better. Interested? Join us!

We are searching in North America. Occasional travel to cool places like Paris, France, may be required.

Benefits

Work from home, wherever you are
Safe and friendly working environment
Stock options for everyone
Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: Invoiced | Backend and Frontend Software Engineers | Austin, TX | Remote ok | Full-time | https://invoiced.com/careers Invoiced is a startup that helps companies ...
items.content:
Invoiced | Backend and Frontend Software Engineers | Austin, TX | Remote ok | Full-time | https://invoiced.com/careers

Invoiced is a startup that helps companies modernize and automate their billing processes. We work with companies that have high-volume or complex billing processes that have recently outgrown/broken their current billing system.

We are looking for both backend and frontend engineers that are passionate about delivering high-quality, testable code (because who likes getting a bill for the wrong amount?). The ideal candidate should be comfortable shipping production-level code in a fast-moving environment. We are currently a team of two developers supporting over 15,000 businesses that rely on our software to get paid.

What we use: PHP (Symfony 4), MariaDB, Redis, AWS, AngularJS

Reach out to us at founders@invoiced.com

items.title: Born Again Media | Medellin, Colombia | REMOTE | Wordpress Developer | Full Time | $14k - $18k
items.content:
Born Again Media | Medellin, Colombia | REMOTE | Wordpress Developer | Full Time | $14k - $18k

Born Again Media is a digital marketing company looking for a talented developer with experience in Wordpress to help us turn designs into clean Wordpress code.

Although the position is fully remote, we're giving priority to applicants from Colombia, where most of the team is based right now.

Learn more, and apply at https://jobs.bornagainmedia.com/o/wordpress-developer . Make sure to mention HN in your application.

items.title: Back End Engineer - PHP @ Modus Create
items.content:
Back End Engineer - PHP @ Modus Create

2018-02-01 16:17

Description

At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. You thrive in an independent, distributed environment. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet.

This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

Responsibilities

  • Upgrade legacy PHP and Laravel MVC Framework based system
  • Develop and integrate Microservices
  • Collaborate daily on a distributed, cross functional agile team

Required Experience

  • 3-5 + yrs PHP development on the backend
  • Strong experience using Laravel MVC Framework
  • Must be familiar with PSRs
  • Previous experience using PHPUnit
  • Documentation tools such as Swagger
  • Must have previous experience building and integrating Microservices
  • Strong foundation of OOP principles
  • ORM for interacting with DB's for example Eloquent (comes with Laravel)
  • Experience upgrading legacy code a plus
  • Experience using JIRA for issue tracking
  • Strong experience using GitHub in a professional environment
  • Previous consulting experience is a plus
  • Be able to communicate effectively in English

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to co-work a significant portion of the day with clients' business hours - GMT-5. This is a full-time, contract position that may be performed from a remote location.

items.title: Hands on CTO for Storemates 'the Airbnb of Storage'
items.content:
Storemates is part of the exciting sharing Economy. We are the 'Airbnb of Storage', connecting people with space.

We have 4000 storage spaces around the UK offering an affordable friendly, local, green alternative to expensive self-storage. Our mission is to create a fantastic marketplace that helps everyone rent out their attics, garages, sheds, spare rooms, driveways to the many people looking for extra storage space.

We have received investment to build and improve our platform with the aim to create an amazing user experience packed with innovative functionality. As the CTO of Storemates, can you help lead the technical transformation of our company to become a leading online storage solution in the next 3 years.

The role involves:

· Developing the strategic vision for our technology
· Overseeing our remote developer team
· Being an excellent communicator to our non-tech orientated board
· Managing our next phase of our site growth and app development.
.Some hands-on 'developer work' at times.

Your experience must cover all of these:

· At least 5 years in technical teams
· Independently resourceful
· Patient (with non techies!) with exceptional communication skills

You should have experience of at least 3 of these:

· Delivered IT Projects
· Day to day maintenance and support of IT Systems
· Line Management Duties
· Operations
· Programming
· Scripting
· SQL
· LAMP stack
· Working with marketing
· Business Analysis

We are looking for someone who can work flexibly with us on a part-time basis and be part of the senior board too. Minimum of 6 days a month.

Working with Storemates is also hugely rewarding and fun. We are in the press constantly with our unique solution to space and are popular spokespeople for the booming 'Sharing Economy'. The senior team is also very experienced, contagiously enthusiastic and will be committed to your support and development. Our special advisers include senior execs from John Lewis, Airbnb, M&S and Visa. This will be a great opportunity to learn and develop new skills and build your networks.

The successful candidate will receive a lucrative equity stake of our fast-growing company and the offer of a paid contract once revenue targets are met, hopefully, between 6-12 months after appointment as our operation starts to scale.

Please do get in touch!

items.title: Full Stack Developer @ I Will Teach You To Be Rich
items.content:
Full Stack Developer @ I Will Teach You To Be Rich

2018-01-24 03:47

Description

Live your Rich Life from anywhere. 100% remote position.

The Giant Hairy Problem You’ll Be Solving

The best of all worlds: a development role in a startup environment without the risk of small organizations or the inflexibility of large ones.

We’re looking for a seasoned full stack developer to join our team to create services that power incredible user experiences.

This could be a dream position for the right person. Read the description below to see if it’s what you’ve been looking for and find out how to apply.

You’ll Work On Projects Like

A Full Stack Developer at IWT is able to work in all parts of an application from backend services to middle tier and the front-end app. You will be developing new solutions to complex problems and work within our existing frameworks, while keeping an open mind to potential process improvements and scalability.

You will be a senior member of the engineering team; with that comes the responsibility of mentoring team members and establishing architectural principles and design patterns. You’ll be translating functional requirements into functional applications. You’ll be doing more than just bug hunting; you’ll be proactively identifying bottlenecks and devising solutions to them.

You will also be interfacing with IWT’s own home-grown solutions as well as with several third party API’s. Expect to be immediately thrown in the deep end and getting into the code right away.

Compensation is commensurate with experience. Perks include health coverage, 401k with match, technology and education stipends, the ability to live anywhere in the US, and work with some of the most interesting people in the world.

What We're Looking For

At IWT we love hard problems that others can't solve, won't solve, or don't even want to try solving. We want to work with people who love big challenges, too. People who want to be the best they can possibly be and fight everyday to make it happen. We call them top performers and we all share the same values:

  • Obsessed with excellence
  • No ego
  • Outstanding communication
  • We drive results
  • Learn fast, grow fast
  • Be weird

If you're a good fit for this opportunity, then you'll have:

  • Broad Experience: You will be working in every aspect of the stack, from top to bottom in a variety of languages.
  • Comfortable in PHP and extremely deep in Ruby
  • Intimately familiar with CakePHP or Rails
  • Lots of practical experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MySQL
  • Experience with AWS
  • Well rounded DevOps and performance tuning experience
  • Experience with Salesforce or Marketo is a definite plus
  • Hands On: You are naturally curious and want to understand how things work. You also aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty and don’t want to pass things off as “not my job” when issue arise.
  • Agile: Able to work iteratively and a willingness to change priorities based on changing business dynamics
  • A vision for the future: A knowledge of industry best practices and an eye toward the future and improving our processes continuously.
  • Able to work remotely with your own phone, computer and high speed internet access in place.
  • This is a full-time, 100% remote position. Must be US based.

About Us

For the past 12 years, we’ve quietly built a private company that has become one of the leaders in online education and self development. Over 1 million Top Performers read us every month for advice on money, entrepreneurship, careers, relationships, and personal productivity. We build no-BS personal-development brands that deliver real results. We tell the truth about how the world works -- even when it’s uncomfortable to hear. We value trust over short-term sales. We’re selective and demanding about who we serve.

We’re a high performance team of exceptionally talented and diverse individuals, and we nurture each other’s personalities, creativity and obsessions to bring forth unique content, products and services to the market. Our goal is to help millions of people live richer, more fulfilling lives. And it takes an entire team committed to something bigger than themselves to make that kind of impact.

We are seeking high caliber individuals who want to help push us to the next level. If you like to move quickly and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are. We’re excited to work alongside the best in the world to make a difference in millions of people’s lives.

If you think you’d be a great addition to our team, click the “Apply Now” button below to submit your application.

Country

United States

items.title: Parklink Development Limited: Lead Technician (Python/PHP)
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Role: Lead Technician [PHP/Python]

TLDR:
Parklink Limited seeks a skilled, motivated candidate to fill the position of remote Lead Technician skilled in Python and PHP, who loves the challenges of high-availabilty SaaS and working with hardware.

Overview:

Parklink Development Limited provides RFID duplication devices to locksmiths and security professionals.

We currently have over 2000 devices deployed and 250,000 badges copied per year. As we greow, we are seeking a skilled & motivated remote lead technician to assist with software development and technical support.

We are a highly optimised / lean company. The successful candidate will have the ability to work autonomously on a constantly evolving product and rapidly expanding client base. You will work on a real product that is used by thousands of people daily. You will be challenged to write and maintain clean, optimised code for such an environment.

We are not another boring SaaS company. We create, manufacture and deploy real hardware on a global scale, with back and front end code managing it all. You'll have a chance to get your hands onto hardware, software, development and deployment. If you're driven, curious, and a hacker at heart, this position is for you.

The successful candidate will interface with our distributors (Europe and Australia) to rapidly and professionaly troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues they may encounter.

Tasks:

As a lead technician, your tasks will be divided into two categories:

  1. SaaS Development (CakePHP)
  2. Embedded Development (Python)

SaaS Development
Our system is backed by a Geographically Distributed High-Availability LAMP stack (Europe + Asia) with all systems redundant and failover ready. The system serves the API to our machine network, and the back office to our clients for admin.

Tasks include

  • Maintaining & Developing the API [PHP / CakePHP]
  • Maintaining & Developing the Administration Interface [PHP / CakePHP]
  • Maintaining & Optimisation of the Database

We have short, medium and long term goals, and milestones setup for our system. You're coming into a stable, clean, code base that we'll give you all necessary training on.

Our frameworks are under GitHub source control, with a CI environment for staging and production.

 We will provide necessary development environments (VirtualBox environment).

Embedded Development 
We have 2000+ deployed networked, touch-screen machines deployed. Each machine is backed by a RPI, with NFC readers and touch screen. We have a custom linux deployment, and the embedded software is Python + Qt [Pyside]

The software is under clean, stable, and under active development. 

Tasks include

  • Maintaining & Developing machine software [Python]
  • Developing / Deploying a Unit Testing framework [Python / ForgLogic Squish]

We will provide all necessary training + hardware required to get started on the  systems.

Technical skills required: 

  • Python 3 [Fluent]
    • QT / PySide Experience Bonus
    • Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests

  • PHP 5/6/7  [Fluent]
    • OOP (PSR-1 & 2) Obligatory
    • CakePHP Experience Bonus
    • Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests (CodeCeption, PHPUnit)

  • Git/GitHub competancy
    • Fluent with Git, respecting & maintaining development procedures (issue branch, code review, pull request, merge, etc)

  • Database (Mysql)
    • Query optimisation for high load environments

  • High Traffic, High Availability Clusters 
    • Experience with distributed server clusters and writing highly optimised code for high-load environments

  • Linux Familiarity
    • Intermediate configuration & administration tasks (SSH, Bash, etc)
    • Rasbian Experience Bonus

  • Hardware Familiarity
    • Raspberry PI
    • Serial / UART

  • NFC Familiarity Bonus
    • 13.56 (Mifare, libNFC, etc)
    • 125KHz (T55, EM4XX etc) 

Personal Skills:

  • Languages:
    • English
    • Fluency in written + spoken
  • Personality:
    • Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently
    • Ability to work autonomously & self-motivate
    • Ability to integrate into an existing team & structure

Time Requirements:

  • This is a full time, remote position (8 hours per day, 5 days per week)
  • Reachable during work hours via phone / slack

Compensation:

  • 40000EU per year
  • 2kEU Hardware Allowance
  • We will provide all training required
  • We will provide all hardware necessary (Devices, parts, badges, etc)
  • Flexible time off: 25 Paid Vacation days + 11 Paid Public Holidays

What we need:

  • Your updated CV
  • A brief email explaining who you are, why you fit the position, and how your experience is relevant.
  • A link to your GitHub/GitLab account
  • An overview of your side projects that you work on / contribute to

Job Perks: - 36 days of paid holiday per year- Hardware development budget

Apply:

items.title: Platform Engineer @ moltin
items.content:
Platform Engineer @ moltin

2017-12-30 02:55

Description

The moltin engineering team builds and maintains all the features for eCommerce in one of the largest RESTful APIs on the internet.

We’re looking for Platform Engineers to architect and implement new features, folks who’ve built cool things, but who can also maintain and scale them.

Benefits

  • Personal tech budget.
  • Regular social events.
  • Conference budget.
  • Bike to Work Scheme & discount travel cards.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Great location.
  • Moltin SWAG.
  • Be part of a fast-growing, venture-backed team.
  • Ability to contribute to and create open source projects.

About Us

  • We use Go, PHP, NodeJS, Lua to name a few.
  • We use datastores like Cassandra, Mongo, Postgres and Redis.
  • We use containerisation heavily.
  • We run our systems globally.
  • We run a micro-service architecture.
  • We test heavily.
  • We experiment readily.

What you will do

  • Participate in peer code reviews.
  • Learn new things.
  • Influence how large scale products are built.
  • Test everything.
  • Write clean, performant code.
  • Fail quickly.
  • Work in an exciting team.
  • Work with modern technology.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience.
  • High competency in at least one of the following languages: PHP, JavaScript, Ruby, or Go.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Experience with microservices/SOA or DevOps would be beneficial.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Experienced Web Engineer Who Loves WordPress at Nolte (Ciudad de México, Mexico) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Advertising, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Nolte is looking for a web engineer to grow with our team. The position is based in our Mexico City office, in Paseo de la Reforma (near the Angel de Independencia), however we will also consider remote applicants.

Our head office is in the heart of New York City, and we have a core presence there but also many people located all over the world. We are a bunch of top-notch product people with a real passion for what we do. We are small but nimble, which we find to be a positive rather than a negative.

We are looking for an engineer who knows a variety of web technologies (JavaScript/React, Python/Django and PHP preferred), and who loves WordPress. Your WordPress experience and passion will help drive the use of this important part of our technology stack.

About Nolte

We create and maintain digital products--everything from apps, to services, to business tools. We ensure the entire process, from ideation to strategy, then design and development, feels cohesive and collaborative.

Nolte exists because of our team members, who transformed their passions into careers. We believe meaningful technology is born when passionate teams create in tandem with committed clientele. Our clients’ visions empower us to use our skills and build the future--together. Their wins are our wins.

By working with Nolte, you’ll get the best product created by a skilled, engaged team.

Benefits

Flexible Work Schedule
Freedom
Ownership of your work
Tuition Re-imbursment

items.title: PHP developer at WealthConductor LLC () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Industry: Financial Services, Financial Technology
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job description

We are looking for a contract developer with the ability and experience to implement a variety of integrations with select partners of the company. Our customers’ #1 wish for our platform is to integrate with their preferred software vendors. Our primary bottleneck in that effort is developer bandwidth, so we need your help writing the code that transforms our partners’ data into data that our system can understand.

This position is 100% remote, but you must be able to overlap regularly with business hours in the US Eastern time zone. The estimated weekly effort is a minimum of 10 hours, which will increase with demonstrated success; pay will be on an hourly basis.

Skills & requirements

  • You know PHP and are familiar with OOP. You'll need these skills to code to the interfaces that we will provide for interacting with our system.
  • You have probably used Guzzle in the past, and if you haven't, then a quick read of the documentation interests you. Some of the work that you'll be doing will involve APIs, and where those APIs do not have SDKs, you'll use Guzzle - or something like it.
  • You have parsed complex text-based files with code in the past, and - as a result - you write defensive code to protect from data that doesn't exactly meet the spec.
  • You have 10 or more hours per week - primarily during business hours in the Eastern time zone - to dedicate to these efforts.
  • You are comfortable working closely with another developer, who will have a large say in the architecture of the code you're writing.
  • You know how to submit a pull request on GitHub - or similar - and are comfortable having your submitted code peer-reviewed.
  • You are comfortable jumping on a call with other stakeholders to talk through implementation details.

About WealthConductor LLC

WealthConductor, LLC is a newly launched firm in the financial services industry that delivers retirement income planning and tracking software to financial advisors nationwide. Our existing product IncomeConductor (IC) is a unique and highly competitive SaaS application with an established user base and aggressive growth plans.

 IC is designed to help advisors easily and intuitively design, implement and monitor income plans for their clients. Their clients include pre-retirees, retirees, and any individual or organization seeking a long-term plan for generating sustainable income from existing savings. We have been helping advisors achieve this goal for over two years now, and have been incorporating their feedback into our strategy and our tools to better serve their needs.

About WealthConductor LLC

We are a small but highly experienced team that has focused on providing tools and services to financial advisors for use with their clients and to grow their business. We collectively have decades of experience with retirement income distribution strategies and implementation.

Benefits

Equity participation, options pool
Partial remote work schedule
Work/Life balance

items.content:

We are looking for a contract developer with the ability and experience to implement a variety of integrations with select partners of the company. Our customers’ #1 wish for our platform is to integrate with their preferred software vendors. Our primary bottleneck in that effort is developer bandwidth, so we need your help writing the code that transforms our partners’ data into data that our system can understand.


This position is 100% remote, but you must be able to overlap regularly with business hours in the US Eastern time zone. The estimated weekly effort is a minimum of 10 hours, which will increase with demonstrated success; pay will be on an hourly basis.

 IC is designed to help advisors easily and intuitively design, implement and monitor income plans for their clients. items.title: Fullstack Application Developers Interested in Sports at VNN Inc (Grand Rapids, MI) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Education, E-Sports, Publishing
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

VNN is looking for experienced Fullstack/PHP Application developers with an interest in sports. People who  can make insightful, rapid, every-day decisions needed in a startup environment.

VNN enables athletic departments to leverage social technologies to promote their sports teams, in doing so crafting a unique and memorable experience for athletes. This person will be comfortable joining a small team leading that charge, based on a keen understanding of VNN’s business goals and strategy.

We favor people who have a passion for sports, and can bring that background and insight into their daily development decisions. We need those who thrive on the pace of a start-up and embrace the many different roles they will have to play. Yet you will still be able to adapt processes and maintain strong design principles, making the trade-offs needed to meet timely delivery schedules.

While you’ll be responsible to work with a small team to ensure the successful execution of our technology strategy, you shouldn’t view yourself as a simple “developer”. Your success will also result from cultivating an ongoing relationship with operations, sales, marketing, technology partners, and advertisers leveraging those unique insights to craft user experience. Being able to work independently and in collaborative phases is a must.

Skills & Requirements

The ideal candidate will be able to meet the requires defined here: What is a Full Stack Developer?

Plus:

  • Be within 4 hours driving distance of Grand Rapids MI
  • 4+ years experience in PHP/MySQL, as well as experience with different programming languages/paradigms
  • A passion for building software to solve complex problems
  • Ability to change directions and priorities often and quickly
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills needed for the success of a remote group that leverages Slack and Hangouts
  • Interested in Sports or related activities

About VNN Inc

VNN Inc is a rapidly growing, highly progressive company that is reshaping high school sports media from the ground up.  Regardless of the role, the VNN team embraces the power of storytelling, and works to bring clarity, beauty and fun to technology that enables fans to share the stories of high school athletes.  We are a company of 20 passionate makers and hustlers, who believe in the disruptive impact the right team and technology can have on an industry.  Our work begins with a deep understanding of the parents, athletes, coaches and administrators that make up high school sports, and ends with simple fun products that impact real people across the country. 

Working with our tight-knit team, you won’t have to worry about big company bureaucracy or not having an impact, the code you work on will be used by thousands on a daily basis.

Benefits

Free Snacks
Great working environment
Get Paid What you Deserve
Health Care
Flexible Remote Team

items.title: Senior Full-Stack PHP Developer at Telesero () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: CRM, Enterprise Software, Telecommunications
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description

As a PHP Developer you will have a range of projects with a focus on Database applications and development architecture.

Responsibilities

  • Designing, developing, debugging, implementing and supporting applications and services.
  • Modify existing software to: correct errors, allow it to function in new operating environment, or improve performance.
  • Design, develop and test end-to-end web, desktop and system applications using several different technologies.
  • Adhering to and recommending improvements to project coding standards.
  • Be responsible for maintaining, expanding and scaling systems.
  • Stay up to date on emerging technologies/industry trends.
  • Debug issues and find fixes in a timely manner.
  • Be able to consistently deliver on-time and at the highest quality.
  • Be mostly available in EST time zone.

Required Skills

  • Minimum 5 years of related programming, testing and system architecture experience.
  • Strong PHP5 and PHP7 coding skills.
  • Solid OOP & design patterns background.
  • Knowing Symfony is considered as an asset.
  • Experience on DBMS (Mysql/MariaDB)
  • Experience on ORM
  • Experience with APIs, Caching Solutions and 3rd Party Integrations.
  • Experience with Git.
  • Experience with client-side scripting in JavaScript and/or jQuery and comfortable working knowledge of HTML and CSS.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly to various new technologies.

Additional Skills

  • Fluent oral and written communication skills (English is a must)
  • Strong time management while working remotely.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to self-manage.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

**Notes on Salary**
We understand that salaries range based on Geographic location mostly, experience and other factors. We are open to paying a fair salary to all employees. 

About Telesero

Telesero is a Customer Interaction Management Software company focused on Communication and Automation. Telesero is Enterprise-Level software for Small, Medium and Large businesses. Mainly focused on Customer Interaction and Communication. Telesero provides omni-channel communication tools for customers to communicate with potential, and existing customers. Automation and Workforce management tools are also a heavy focus of Telesero. Bringing automation, and eliminating human error through the use of software.

Benefits

Longterm Growth Potential
Experienced Team
Longterm Business Strategy

items.title: codelathe: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer

Posted Dec 6

codelathe
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://www.getfilecloud.com/jobs/

About CodeLathe

At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collaboration and productivity while providing ironclad data protection. Our product FileCloud is quickly becoming the standard in Enterprise File Services space and it is widely used by Global 2000, Fortune 500 and world leading organizations in city, state and federal governments. We are based out of Austin, Texas, USA and looking for talented people anywhere in the globe. 

Our Vision

Organize enterprise information and make it universally accessible!

Top Ten Reasons to Join Us

  1. Work with a world class engineering team that is out to change the world
  2. Fast growing company with lots of growth opportunities
  3. Strong engineering and product focused culture
  4. 100% Remote Job – Work comfortably from your home office and avoid the commute
  5. Unique, customer driven software development process
  6. Work on the most challenging technical problems – File Systems, Search, AI, Distributed Systems.
  7. Work on widely used cutting edge tech stack
  8. Gender diversity – Men (60%), Women (40%)
  9. Part of a huge 10+ Billion $ and growing market space
  10. Competitive compensation based on experience and location

Responsibilities

  • Create elegant, efficient and maintainable software to support and extend our current software products
  • Solve complex architectural challenges when implementing new features
  • Integrate with databases, file systems, cloud services when delivering solutions
  • Troubleshoot and fix reported customer issues, delivering software patches as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or in related discipline with 4 or more years of professional software engineering experience, at least 3 years experience in web app development
  • Strong knowledge of web technologies including HTTP protocol, XML, REST is required
  • Strong knowledge of Object Oriented programming, design patterns etc is required
  • Strong knowledge of client server architecture is required
  • 4+ years in PHP development is required
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 is required
  • Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
  • Self starter, highly motivated and works with little or no supervision
  • Passionate in software development, takes ownership and pride in their job


Location: Remote.  Compensation is based on experience and location. 

Apply for this position

Send a resume to jobs@codelathe.com. Please refer Job ID: FSE4 as a subject line.

items.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
About CodeLathe

At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collaboration and productivity while providing ironclad data protection. Our product FileCloud is quickly becoming the standard in Enterprise File Services space and it is widely used by Global 2000, Fortune 500 and world leading organizations in city, state and federal governments. We are based out of Austin, Texas, USA and looking for talented people anywhere in the globe. 

Our Vision

Organize enterprise information and make it universally accessible!

Top Ten Reasons to Join Us

  1. Work with a world class engineering team that is out to change the world
  2. Fast growing company with lots of growth opportunities
  3. Strong engineering and product focused culture
  4. 100% Remote Job – Work comfortably from your home office and avoid the commute
  5. Unique, customer driven software development process
  6. Work on the most challenging technical problems – File Systems, Search, AI, Distributed Systems.
  7. Work on widely used cutting edge tech stack
  8. Gender diversity – Men (60%), Women (40%)
  9. Part of a huge 10+ Billion $ and growing market space
  10. Competitive compensation based on experience and location

Responsibilities

  • Create elegant, efficient and maintainable software to support and extend our current software products
  • Solve complex architectural challenges when implementing new features
  • Integrate with databases, file systems, cloud services when delivering solutions
  • Troubleshoot and fix reported customer issues, delivering software patches as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or in related discipline with 4 or more years of professional software engineering experience, at least 3 years experience in web app development
  • Strong knowledge of web technologies including HTTP protocol, XML, REST is required
  • Strong knowledge of Object Oriented programming, design patterns etc is required
  • Strong knowledge of client server architecture is required
  • 4+ years in PHP development is required
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 is required
  • Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
  • Self starter, highly motivated and works with little or no supervision
  • Passionate in software development, takes ownership and pride in their job


Location: Remote.  Compensation is based on experience and location. 

To apply: Send a resume to jobs@codelathe.com. Please refer Job ID: FSE4 as a subject line.

items.title: Veteran WordPress Developer @ Artbees
items.content:
Veteran WordPress Developer @ Artbees

2017-12-04 15:04

Description

Artbees is looking for a full-time Veteran WordPress Developer. We are specialized in building WordPress themes and plugins, so a strong familiarity and interest in WordPress and its platform is a must. Your major responsibility as a Full Stack Developer will be to extend the capabilities of WordPress by building tools and modules that will make website building a fun and interactive experience.If you’re passionate about WordPress, write clean, well-documented code and are interested in tackling a series of new, exciting projects, we want to talk to you.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years experience coding skills with WordPress
  • Professional level backend and frontend coding skills
  • Hands on custom WordPress development at scale
  • An excellent Knowledge of PHP
  • Deep understanding of WordPress architecture, developing custom themes, custom content types and creating custom plugins
  • Fluid knowledge of JavaScript (we do not mean jQuery, you must write great Vanilla JS)
  • Ability to work with Git
  • Ability to work with CI tools is a bonus
  • Experience creating, building and working with APIs
  • Knowledge in WordPress security and optimization
  • Familiar with Agile and Scrum workflows
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills in English
  • Have had a team work experience (with developers and QA team)

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain the technical architecture of applications
  • Ability to quickly shift between multiple projects and technologies
  • Must be highly organized; capable of developing and meeting the project deadline
  • Write clean code and test it throughout the development process to ensure the top-tier quality

Benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • We cover the cost of your learning materials
  • Paid travel & Accommodation to headquarters
  • Flexible and fair time off policy
  • Birthday surprises
  • Spotify subscription gifts

We need to learn about your most accomplished projects. we expect a CV attached to your application or a link to your online portfolio.

We accept Remote and on-site applicants.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Remote world-wide, or onsite in Turkey

items.title: Senior Symfony Developer
items.content:
Senior Symfony Developer at payever

Hamburg, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Symfony2, Symfony3
Compensation
$0K–$1K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Join the payever team!
--------------------------

payever started with a simple idea: We wanted to make buying and selling easier everyday. With a team of over 70+ members around the world we´ve built a unique CommerceOS with all the tools people need to start, run and grow their business. We moved to the heart of Hamburg to connect customers with businesses by realising our vision of a modern consumer experience. Today we are an internationally operating, high growth startup.

Join a team of digital natives with deep retail and tech expertise, backed by Europe's leading early stage investors High Tech-Gründerfonds and Microsoft Ventures.

Developers are the core of our work - Creating clean, readable code and bringing ideas into life. This is why we are looking for motivated, talented individuals to join our remote team as full-time Symfony backend developers.

What will you be doing?
---------------------------

- Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable PHP code
- Implement performance and quality modules
- Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
- Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
- Collaborate with team members in creating a sophisticated, usable product

You'd ideally have:
---------------------

- Minimum 6 years of experience in PHP;
- Minimum 3 years of experience using Symfony — a MUST;
- Work experience with FOSRestBundle;
- Experience in work with keys through SSH;
- Experience with PHPUnit or similar testing tool;
- JavaScript, HTML/CSS (we split front and back development, but you need to be familiar);
- Familiarity with Github;
- Desire to be a part of an international team;
- On-time delivery and commitment to long-term cooperation;
- Degree in computer science, engineering;
- Adaptability — Fintech changes incredibly fast, and we expect to change accordingly.

The following will be a big plus:
- Experience with .js frameworks.
- Experience with microservices

What we offer:
----------------

A chance to take part in innovation.
Our goal is nothing short of solving ALL of the problems of modern commerce. Join us on a mission to change the way business works.

Competitive pay rates.
We want our talent to be able to fully concentrate on their work. Which is why we make sure you are paid well, and on time.

A learning experience.
We innovate, improve and change constantly to deliver maximum efficiency. So others can learn from our results.

Get more done.
Flat hierarchies and short decision paths mean that more of your ideas are heard, and turned into realities.

Working remotely.
Whether you want to climb the Alps or run with the bulls in Pamplona, we’ll support your vision, as long as you do your part with us.

To apply:
----------

Please send your Resume, Linkedin Profile and/or website to jobs(@)getpayever.com or submit an application through this page.

We look forward to hearing from you!
